questions.question: What is $1 \land 1$ (1 AND 1)?
questions.hint: AND returns $1$ only when BOTH inputs are $1$. Are both inputs $1$ here?

questions.question: What is $0 \lor 1$ (0 OR 1)?
questions.hint: OR returns $1$ if at least one input is $1$. Is there at least one $1$?

questions.question: If $A = 1$, what is $\overline{A}$ (NOT $A$)?
questions.hint: NOT inverts the input - it gives the opposite value in binary.

questions.question: What is $0 \land 0$ (0 AND 0)?
questions.hint: AND needs BOTH inputs to be $1$ for output to be $1$. Both inputs are $0$ here.

questions.question: What is $1 \lor 0$ (1 OR 0)?
questions.hint: OR returns $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Is there at least one $1$ among the inputs?

questions.question: If $A = 0$, what is $\overline{A}$ (NOT $A$)?
questions.hint: NOT inverts the input - what's the opposite of $0$ in binary?

questions.question: What is $1 \land 0$ (1 AND 0)?
questions.hint: AND needs ALL inputs to be $1$. If even one is $0$, what's the result?

questions.question: What is $0 \lor 0$ (0 OR 0)?
questions.hint: OR returns $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Are any of these inputs $1$?

questions.question: What is $1 \lor 1$ (1 OR 1)?
questions.hint: OR returns $1$ if ANY input is $1$. In binary, the result is always $0$ or $1$, never $2$.

questions.question: What is $0 \land 1$ (0 AND 1)?
questions.hint: AND needs BOTH inputs to be $1$. Is that the case here?

questions.question: Which gate gives $1$ ONLY when both inputs are $1$?
questions.hint: This gate requires both (ALL) inputs to be $1$ - think of the word that means 'both'.

questions.question: Which gate gives $1$ when ANY input is $1$?
questions.hint: This gate outputs $1$ if one input is $1$, or the other is $1$, or both are $1$.

questions.question: What output does this NOT gate give when input is $0$?

questions.question: What output does this NOT gate give when input is $1$?

questions.hint: This is a NOT gate (inverter). If $1$ goes in, what comes out?

questions.question: Complete the truth table: $A=0$, $B=1$, $A \land B = ?$
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="140" viewBox="0 0 200 140"><rect x="20" y="20" width="160" height="100" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="80" y1="20" x2="80" y2="120" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1"/><line x1="130" y1="20" x2="130" y2="120" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1"/><line x1="20" y1="50" x2="180" y2="50" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1"/><text x="45" y="40" font-size="14" fill="#374151" font-weight="bold">A</text><text x="100" y="40" font-size="14" fill="#374151" font-weight="bold">B</text><text x="140" y="40" font-size="14" fill="#374151" font-weight="bold">A AND B</text><text x="45" y="90" font-size="14" fill="#374151">0</text><text x="100" y="90" font-size="14" fill="#374151">1</text><text x="150" y="90" font-size="18" fill="#EF4444">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: AND needs BOTH to be $1$. Here one is $0$ and one is $1$...

questions.question: Complete the truth table: $A=1$, $B=0$, $A \lor B = ?$
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="140" viewBox="0 0 200 140"><rect x="20" y="20" width="160" height="100" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="80" y1="20" x2="80" y2="120" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="1"/><line x1="130" y1="20" x2="130" y2="120" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="1"/><line x1="20" y1="50" x2="180" y2="50" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="1"/><text x="45" y="40" font-size="14" fill="#374151" font-weight="bold">A</text><text x="100" y="40" font-size="14" fill="#374151" font-weight="bold">B</text><text x="140" y="40" font-size="14" fill="#374151" font-weight="bold">A OR B</text><text x="45" y="90" font-size="14" fill="#374151">1</text><text x="100" y="90" font-size="14" fill="#374151">0</text><text x="150" y="90" font-size="18" fill="#EF4444">?</text></svg>
questions.hint: OR returns $1$ if at least one input is $1$. Is at least one input $1$ here?

questions.question: What is $\overline{\overline{A}}$ (NOT NOT $A$) if $A = 1$?
questions.hint: NOT flips the value. What happens when you flip something twice?

questions.question: What is $\overline{\overline{A}}$ (NOT NOT $A$) if $A = 0$?
questions.hint: NOT flips the value. What happens when you flip $0$ twice?

questions.question: If $A = 1$ and $B = 1$, what is $A \land B$?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ only when both inputs are $1$. What are the inputs here?

questions.question: If $A = 0$ and $B = 0$, what is $A \lor B$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if at least one input is $1$. Are any inputs $1$ here?

questions.question: What does the NOT gate do to an input?
questions.hint: Think about what 'NOT' means - it gives you the opposite.

questions.question: If $A = 1$ and $B = 0$, what is $A \land B$?
questions.hint: AND needs BOTH inputs to be $1$. Is that true here?

questions.question: If $A = 0$ and $B = 1$, what is $A \lor B$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if at least one input is $1$. Check both inputs.

questions.question: How many inputs does a NOT gate have?
questions.hint: NOT inverts a single value - how many values does it need?

questions.question: How many inputs does an AND gate typically have?
questions.hint: AND compares two values to see if BOTH are $1$.

questions.question: How many inputs does an OR gate typically have?
questions.hint: OR checks if ANY of two values is $1$.

questions.question: What is the output of an AND gate when both inputs are $0$?
questions.hint: AND needs BOTH inputs to be $1$ to output $1$. Are they both $1$ here?

questions.question: What is the output of an OR gate when both inputs are $1$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if at least one input is $1$. Remember: output is always $0$ or $1$.

questions.question: Which statement about AND is true?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ only when BOTH inputs are $1$. Which option shows both inputs as $1$?

questions.question: Which statement about OR is FALSE?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Find the statement that contradicts this rule.

questions.question: What is $\overline{0}$ (NOT 0)?
questions.hint: NOT gives the opposite of the input. What's the opposite of $0$?

questions.question: What is $\overline{1}$ (NOT 1)?
questions.hint: NOT gives the opposite of the input. What's the opposite of $1$?

questions.question: In logic gates, what values can inputs and outputs have?
questions.hint: Logic gates work with binary values. How many different values are in binary?

questions.question: What does TRUE represent in a logic gate?
questions.hint: In binary logic, TRUE and FALSE are represented by two specific digits.

questions.question: What does FALSE represent in a logic gate?
questions.hint: In binary logic, FALSE is represented by which digit?

questions.question: If TRUE $= 1$ and FALSE $= 0$, what is TRUE AND TRUE?
questions.hint: AND returns TRUE ($1$) when both inputs are TRUE ($1$).

questions.question: If TRUE $= 1$ and FALSE $= 0$, what is TRUE AND FALSE?
questions.hint: AND needs BOTH inputs to be TRUE. Is that the case here?

questions.question: If TRUE $= 1$ and FALSE $= 0$, what is FALSE OR TRUE?
questions.hint: OR returns TRUE if at least one input is TRUE.

questions.question: If TRUE $= 1$ and FALSE $= 0$, what is FALSE OR FALSE?
questions.hint: OR returns TRUE if at least one input is TRUE. Are any inputs TRUE here?

questions.question: If TRUE $= 1$ and FALSE $= 0$, what is NOT TRUE?
questions.hint: NOT gives the opposite. What is the opposite of TRUE?

questions.question: If TRUE $= 1$ and FALSE $= 0$, what is NOT FALSE?
questions.hint: NOT gives the opposite. What is the opposite of FALSE?

questions.question: Complete: $1 \land 1 = ?$
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ when both inputs are $1$. Are both inputs $1$ here?

questions.question: Complete: $0 \land 0 = ?$
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ only when BOTH inputs are $1$. Are they both $1$?

questions.question: Complete: $1 \land 0 = ?$
questions.hint: AND needs both inputs to be $1$. One input is $0$ here.

questions.question: Complete: $0 \land 1 = ?$
questions.hint: AND needs both inputs to be $1$. One input is $0$ here.

questions.question: Complete: $1 \lor 1 = ?$
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if any input is $1$. The result is always $0$ or $1$.

questions.question: Complete: $0 \lor 0 = ?$
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Are there any $1$s here?

questions.question: Complete: $1 \lor 0 = ?$
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if at least one input is $1$. Is there a $1$ here?

questions.question: Complete: $0 \lor 1 = ?$
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if at least one input is $1$. Check the second input.

questions.question: What is the symbol for AND in logic?
questions.hint: The AND symbol looks like an upside-down V or a wedge pointing up.

questions.question: What is the symbol for OR in logic?
questions.hint: The OR symbol looks like a V or a wedge pointing down.

questions.question: What is the symbol for NOT in logic?
questions.hint: NOT is shown with a bar over the variable or a special symbol before it.

questions.question: An AND gate is like which everyday situation?
answers: Either key or code opens the door
Need both keys to open a safe
questions.hint: AND requires BOTH conditions to be true - like needing multiple things to work together.

questions.question: An OR gate is like which everyday situation?
answers: Either cash or card pays for lunch
Flipping a switch on and off
questions.hint: OR works if ANY condition is true - like having multiple ways to achieve something.

questions.question: A NOT gate is like which everyday situation?
answers: Flipping a switch to the opposite position
questions.hint: NOT reverses the input - like changing something to its opposite.

questions.question: What does an AND gate output when $A = 0$, $B = 0$?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ only when BOTH inputs are $1$. Neither input is $1$ here.

questions.question: What does an AND gate output when $A = 0$, $B = 1$?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ only when BOTH inputs are $1$. Is that true here?

questions.question: What does an AND gate output when $A = 1$, $B = 0$?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ only when BOTH inputs are $1$. One input is $0$ here.

questions.question: What does an AND gate output when $A = 1$, $B = 1$?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ when BOTH inputs are $1$. Check if both are $1$.

questions.question: What does an OR gate output when $A = 0$, $B = 0$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Are there any $1$s among the inputs?

questions.question: What does an OR gate output when $A = 0$, $B = 1$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. The second input is $1$.

questions.question: What does an OR gate output when $A = 1$, $B = 0$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. The first input is $1$.

questions.question: What does an OR gate output when $A = 1$, $B = 1$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Both inputs are $1$, but output is still just $1$.

questions.question: What does a NOT gate output when input is $0$?
questions.hint: NOT inverts the input. What is the opposite of $0$?

questions.question: What does a NOT gate output when input is $1$?
questions.hint: NOT inverts the input. What is the opposite of $1$?

questions.question: Which gate always outputs the opposite of its input?
questions.hint: This gate inverts whatever you put in - $0$ becomes $1$, $1$ becomes $0$.

questions.question: Which gate outputs $1$ only when ALL inputs are $1$?
questions.hint: This gate is like a strict bouncer - everyone must be $1$ to get a $1$ output.

questions.question: Which gate outputs $1$ when at least one input is $1$?
questions.hint: This gate is lenient - if ANY input is $1$, output is $1$.

questions.question: If you apply NOT twice to $1$, what do you get?
questions.hint: NOT of $1$ is $0$. NOT of $0$ is what?

questions.question: If you apply NOT twice to $0$, what do you get?
questions.hint: NOT of $0$ is $1$. NOT of $1$ is what?

questions.question: What is $1 \land (1 \land 1)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate inside parentheses: $1 \land 1$. Then AND that with $1$.

questions.question: What is $0 \lor (0 \lor 0)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate inside parentheses: $0 \lor 0$. Then OR that with $0$.

questions.question: What is $1 \lor (0 \land 1)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate parentheses: $0 \land 1$. Then OR the result with $1$.

questions.question: What is $0 \land (1 \lor 1)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate parentheses: $1 \lor 1$. Then AND the result with $0$.

questions.question: What is $\overline{(1 \land 1)}$ (NOT of 1 AND 1)?
questions.hint: First evaluate: $1 \land 1$. Then apply NOT to the result.

questions.question: What is $\overline{(0 \lor 0)}$ (NOT of 0 OR 0)?
questions.hint: First evaluate: $0 \lor 0$. Then apply NOT to the result.

questions.question: What is $(1 \lor 0) \land (0 \lor 1)$?
questions.hint: Evaluate both parentheses first, then AND the results together.

questions.question: What is $(1 \land 0) \lor (0 \land 1)$?
questions.hint: Evaluate both parentheses first (both are $0$), then OR them together.

questions.question: What is $\overline{0} \land \overline{0}$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $0$ for each input. Then AND those results.

questions.question: What is $\overline{1} \lor \overline{1}$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $1$ for each input. Then OR those results.

questions.question: What is $1 \land \overline{0}$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $0$. Then AND that with $1$.

questions.question: What is $0 \lor \overline{1}$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $1$. Then OR that with $0$.

questions.question: What is $\overline{1} \land 1$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $1$. Then AND that result with $1$.

questions.question: What is $\overline{0} \lor 0$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $0$. Then OR that result with $0$.

questions.question: How many rows are in a complete truth table for a 2-input gate?
questions.hint: Each input can be $0$ or $1$. How many combinations of two inputs are there?

questions.question: In a truth table, what are the possible input combinations for $A$ and $B$?
questions.hint: Each variable can be $0$ or $1$. List all combinations systematically.

questions.question: In an AND truth table, how many rows have output $1$?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ only when both inputs are $1$. How many ways can that happen?

questions.question: In an OR truth table, how many rows have output $1$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if any input is $1$. Only $(0,0)$ gives $0$, so how many give $1$?

questions.question: In an OR truth table, how many rows have output $0$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $0$ only when both inputs are $0$. How many ways can that happen?

questions.question: In an AND truth table, how many rows have output $0$?
questions.hint: AND outputs $0$ unless both inputs are $1$. How many combinations are NOT both $1$?

questions.question: What is $(0 \land 1) \lor 1$?
questions.hint: First evaluate the AND, then OR the result with $1$.

questions.question: What is $(1 \lor 0) \land 0$?
questions.hint: First evaluate the OR, then AND the result with $0$.

questions.question: What is $\overline{(0 \land 0)}$?
questions.hint: First compute $0 \land 0$. Then apply NOT to the result.

questions.question: What is $\overline{(1 \lor 0)}$?
questions.hint: First compute $1 \lor 0$. Then apply NOT to the result.

questions.question: If the light is ON when switch A AND switch B are both ON, which gate is this?
questions.hint: The light needs BOTH switches - this is like which logical operation?

questions.question: If the alarm sounds when sensor A OR sensor B detects motion, which gate is this?
questions.hint: The alarm triggers if EITHER sensor detects motion - this is like which operation?

questions.question: If a door unlocks when the button is NOT pressed, which gate controls this?
questions.hint: The door does the OPPOSITE of the button state - this is like which operation?

questions.question: What is $A \land A$ when $A = 1$?
questions.hint: If $A = 1$, then you're computing $1 \land 1$.

questions.question: What is $A \land A$ when $A = 0$?
questions.hint: If $A = 0$, then you're computing $0 \land 0$.

questions.question: What is $A \lor A$ when $A = 1$?
questions.hint: If $A = 1$, then you're computing $1 \lor 1$.

questions.question: What is $A \lor A$ when $A = 0$?
questions.hint: If $A = 0$, then you're computing $0 \lor 0$.

questions.question: What is $A \land \overline{A}$ when $A = 1$?
questions.hint: If $A = 1$, then $\overline{A} = 0$. What is $1 \land 0$?

questions.question: What is $A \land \overline{A}$ when $A = 0$?
questions.hint: If $A = 0$, then $\overline{A} = 1$. What is $0 \land 1$?

questions.question: What is $A \lor \overline{A}$ when $A = 1$?
questions.hint: If $A = 1$, then $\overline{A} = 0$. What is $1 \lor 0$?

questions.question: What is $A \lor \overline{A}$ when $A = 0$?
questions.hint: If $A = 0$, then $\overline{A} = 1$. What is $0 \lor 1$?

questions.question: Is $A \land \overline{A}$ always $0$ or always $1$?
questions.hint: Try both cases: when $A=0$ and when $A=1$. What do you get each time?

questions.question: Is $A \lor \overline{A}$ always $0$ or always $1$?
questions.hint: Try both cases: when $A=0$ and when $A=1$. What do you get each time?

questions.question: What is the output of NOT gate with input $0$?
questions.hint: NOT flips the bit. The opposite of $0$ is...?

questions.question: What is the output of NOT gate with input $1$?
questions.hint: NOT flips the bit. The opposite of $1$ is...?

questions.question: TRUE AND FALSE equals what?
questions.hint: AND requires BOTH to be TRUE. Is that the case here?

questions.question: FALSE AND FALSE equals what?
questions.hint: AND requires BOTH to be TRUE. Are both TRUE here?

questions.question: TRUE OR FALSE equals what?
questions.hint: OR needs at least one TRUE. Is there at least one?

questions.question: FALSE OR FALSE equals what?
questions.hint: OR needs at least one TRUE. Are any of the inputs TRUE?

questions.question: NOT TRUE equals what?
questions.hint: NOT gives the opposite. What is opposite of TRUE?

questions.question: NOT FALSE equals what?
questions.hint: NOT gives the opposite. What is opposite of FALSE?

questions.question: Which expression always equals $0$?
questions.hint: A value ANDed with its opposite is always...?

questions.question: Which expression always equals $1$?
questions.hint: A value ORed with its opposite is always...?

questions.question: What is $1 \land (0 \lor 1)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate inside the parentheses, then AND with $1$.

questions.question: What is $0 \lor (1 \land 0)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate inside the parentheses, then OR with $0$.

questions.question: What is $(1 \land 1) \lor 0$?
questions.hint: First evaluate the AND, then OR the result with $0$.

questions.question: What is $(0 \lor 0) \land 1$?
questions.hint: First evaluate the OR, then AND the result with $1$.

questions.question: What is $\overline{(1 \land 0)}$?
questions.hint: First compute $1 \land 0$, then apply NOT.

questions.question: What is $\overline{(0 \lor 1)}$?
questions.hint: First compute $0 \lor 1$, then apply NOT.

questions.question: What is $\overline{\overline{0}}$?
questions.hint: Apply NOT twice. What happens when you flip $0$ twice?

questions.question: What is $\overline{\overline{1}}$?
questions.hint: Apply NOT twice. What happens when you flip $1$ twice?

questions.question: If AND gate has inputs $A=1$ and $B=1$, what is the output?
questions.hint: AND outputs $1$ when both inputs are $1$.

questions.question: If OR gate has inputs $A=0$ and $B=0$, what is the output?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if any input is $1$. Are there any $1$s?

questions.question: What is $(\overline{0}) \land 1$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $0$, then AND that with $1$.

questions.question: What is $(\overline{1}) \lor 0$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $1$, then OR that with $0$.

questions.question: What is $1 \land (\overline{0})$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $0$, then AND $1$ with that result.

questions.question: What is $0 \lor (\overline{1})$?
questions.hint: First find NOT $1$, then OR $0$ with that result.

questions.question: A gate with one input and one output that flips the value is called?
questions.hint: This gate inverts or negates the input.

questions.question: A gate that needs both inputs to be $1$ for output $1$ is called?
questions.hint: Think about the word that means 'both' in logic.

questions.question: A gate that gives $1$ if any input is $1$ is called?
questions.hint: Think about the word that means 'either' in logic.

questions.question: In a NOT truth table, how many rows are there?
questions.hint: NOT has one input. How many values can one binary input have?

questions.question: What is the output when $A = 0$, $B = 1$, $C = 1$ for $A \land (B \lor C)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate $B \lor C$, then AND that result with $A$.

questions.question: What is the output when $A = 1$, $B = 0$, $C = 0$ for $A \lor (B \land C)$?
questions.hint: First evaluate $B \land C$, then OR that result with $A$.

questions.question: Complete: If $A = 0$, then $\overline{A} = ?$
questions.hint: NOT flips the value. What is the opposite of $0$?

questions.question: Complete: If $A = 1$, then $\overline{A} = ?$
questions.hint: NOT flips the value. What is the opposite of $1$?

questions.question: What is $0 \land 1 \land 1$?
questions.hint: AND requires ALL inputs to be $1$. Is that true here?

questions.question: What is $0 \lor 0 \lor 1$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Is there at least one $1$?

questions.question: What is $1 \land 1 \land 1$?
questions.hint: AND requires ALL inputs to be $1$. Are they all $1$?

questions.question: What is $0 \lor 0 \lor 0$?
questions.hint: OR outputs $1$ if ANY input is $1$. Are any inputs $1$?

questions.question: Which gate would you use to check if BOTH conditions are met?
questions.hint: Think about the meaning of 'both' - which operation requires all inputs to be true?

questions.question: Which gate would you use to check if EITHER condition is met?
questions.hint: Think about the meaning of 'either' - which operation accepts any true input?

questions.question: Which gate would you use to invert a signal?
questions.hint: Inverting means flipping $0$ to $1$ and $1$ to $0$.

questions.question: What is $(1 \lor 1) \land (0 \lor 0)$?
questions.hint: Evaluate both parentheses first, then AND the results.
